snippet: Ayman al-Zawahri had been seen as ineffectual, but a secret correspondence with the Yemeni Qaeda affiliate leader suggests he might still bear major authority.
abstract: Secret correspondance between Al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahri and Yemeni operative Nasir ul-Wuhayshi has caused concern within American government about potential terrorist plot by group; some analysts hold to prevailing view of Zawahri as ineffectual, but others say he may still pose threat.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London, and Nasser Arrabyee from Sana, Yemen.

lead_paragraph: Ayman al-Zawahri had been seen as ineffectual, but a secret correspondence with the Yemeni Qaeda affiliate leader suggests he might still bear major authority.

headline.main: Messages by Qaeda Chief Spur New Look at His Sway
headline.print_headline: Messages by Qaeda Chief Spur New Look at His Sway
